wines.name: Karia
wines.description: This is a graceful Chardonnay with generous aromas of Asian pear, honeydew melon and lime along with a touch of hazelnut and vanilla oak. Medium-bodied, the wine has a silky texture and mid palate leading to a soft finish with a touch of creamy oak.

wines.name: DANIKA RANCH
wines.description: Rich and full-bodied, this Chardonnay highlights the characteristics of our Danika Ranch with notes of ripe mango, pineapple, crème brulee and jasmine. The palate has a rich texture with nice acidity and a touch of cinnamon, flint and dried hay on the finish.

wines.name: RANCHO CHIMILES
wines.description: This Semillon opens with fresh aromas of lychee, passion fruit, lemon zest and fig. Medium-bodied with fresh acidity, the palate is savory with a lasting bright finish.

wines.name: AVETA
wines.description: The 2018 AVETA Sauvignon Blanc offers an expressive nose of tangerine, papaya, guava, orange blossom, pineapple and lemongrass. The wine has bright acidity and a flavorful mid-palate that leads to a long finish filled with orange zest and kiwi flavors.

wines.name: Winemaker Series Lot 1
wines.description: This Cabernet Sauvignon delivers generous aromas of blackberry jam, ripe blueberry, fig, orange peel and a touch of crème brulee. Made in a bold style, this rich and concentrated wine has layers of dark fruit along with savory tannins and a powerful finish. Enjoy with herb-crusted pork roast, duck confit or grilled Portobello mushrooms tossed in olive oil with fresh rosemary.

wines.name: ARCADIA VINEYARD
wines.description: This ARCADIA VINEYARD Chardonnay offers delicate, expressive aromas of stone fruit, pear, honeydew melon and jasmine. The wine is vibrant with refreshing acidity on the palate with nice fruit and floral flavors. The mouthfeel is silky with a lingering finish.

wines.name: ARMILLARY
wines.description: This wine has a balanced nose with cassis, cinnamon, nutmeg and ripe persimmon notes. Full-bodied, the wine has a flavorful entrance filled with boysenberry, mocha and spice along with a structured mid-palate and long finish.

wines.name: FAY
wines.description: Inviting aromas of ripe berries, figs, plums, candied cherries, strawberry preserves, and a touch of a jasmine perfume. The wine has a bright and lively entry and mid-palate, which is nicely-balanced with rich polished tannins and cherry pie aftertaste.

wines.name: S.L.V.
wines.description: Generous aromas of dark chocolate, graphite, truffle, dried fig and a lovely touch of violet. Rich and refined on the mid-palate, the wine has a long and well-structured finish with a dusty cocoa powder note. The tannin structure, rich dark fruit, and pleasing minerality point to this wine’s ability to age.

wines.name: CASK 23
wines.description: The wine opens with a rich berry medley and silky, layered aromas of dates, cocoa spice, cassis, black olive, and pomegranate. The palate is full in structure, yet balanced and persistent with a lush texture. Flavors of currant, dark cherry, and spice linger on the finish.

wines.name: Winemaker Series Lot 1
wines.description: This Malbec has spicy aromas of ripe plum and dark fruit along with hints of cinnamon, floral and tea leaf. Rich in texture, the wine coats the palate with raspberry jam and dark chocolate flavors that are supported by fine-grained tannins.

wines.name: Winemaker Series
wines.description: This Petit Verdot has a perfumed nose filled with floral and spice along with notes of cassis, green tea, dried lavender and sage. The wine is dark in color and rich with polished tannins and a concentrated finish.

wines.name: HEART of FAY
wines.description: This FAY Cabernet Sauvignon has perfumed aromas along with hints of flint, cedar, cinnamon and olive. The wine is plush and fruity with a round mid-palate that leads to a long finish with a touch of oak spice.

wines.name: Artemis
wines.description: The 2018 ARTEMIS Cabernet Sauvignon delivers expressive aromas of ripe raspberry, dark cherry and blackberry along with hints of cedar and spice. The mid-palate is pleasant and round with flavors of dark chocolate, plum, dried fruit and toasted oak. The finish is rich and lingering.

wines.name: Èlevèe Vineyard
wines.description: Élevée Vineyard, planted in 1998 and located in the heart of the Dundee Hills sub-AVA, gives us classic characteristics of a sweet textured palate with red fruit and spice. Vineyard owners, Tom and France Fitzpatrick, care for each individual vine, always looking to grow better fruit each vintage for winemakers who source from their site. With limited fruit from this small 4-acre vineyard, we carefully select blocks with clonal plantings of Dijon 115, 777, and Pommard to produce a delicate and well-rounded wine.

wines.name: Aegrina Vineyard
wines.description: Aegrina Vineyard, located in the McMinnville sub-AVA, is one of the most distinct vineyards in our portfolio. The name, Aegrina, loosely translates to 'full of love' - the winemaker's love of the fruit, our vineyard manager's love for the vines, and the love you will feel for this wine at first taste. Lynn and Ron Penner-Ash helped map out the southeast facing slope of the vineyard and assisted with the clonal selection. The site is planted to a variety of Dijon clones, Pommard, and Wädenswil. This diverse planting produces wines that are dark, dense, and texturally sweet.

wines.name: Pas De Nom
wines.description: Pas De Nom loosely translated means 'no name' in the spirit of refined simplicity and nuance. Each year this small production wine sourced from premier vineyards across multiple AVAs aims to represent the unique quality of a specific vintage here in the Willamette Valley. Barrel selected to create a blend with structure, elegance, volume, fruit, and intensity.

wines.name: Oregon
wines.description: In 1999, we began sourcing fruit with an eye to making a unique Oregon Syrah. Over the years, we slowly developed our signature Penner-Ash Syrah style, a balance between structure and sweetness from the warmer southern Oregon vineyards, and blue fruit notes, nice acidity, and freshness from Hood River sourcing.

wines.name: Oregon
wines.description: We produced our first bottling of this wine in 2000, blown away by how pretty the Viognier fruit was we were seeing in the vineyards, and the flavors that burst from the grape when you popped one into your mouth. We love the uniqueness of this white variety and strive to always create a wine showcasing beautiful fruit, and the delicacy and freshness of our cooler Oregon climate.

wines.name: Willamette Valley
wines.description: This wine reflects the region’s distinct textures, flavors and terroir, with beautiful elegance and balance. Since the inaugural vintage in 1998, founding winemaker Lynn Penner-Ash has drawn upon longstanding relationships with grower neighbors and friends, to source fruit from the most distinguished vineyards. The 2018 vintage explores six sub-AVAs, culminating in a Pinot Noir emblematic of the Willamette Valley, and of the Penner-Ash winemaking style – a textural experience from start to finish.
